content.raw: Thinking on downstream maintainers (those working in supporting gazebo for the different platforms and distributions) it would be nice to mention that we are introducing a new optional dependency. Quickly looking at the changelog they will be able to find that their package could need an update on its packaging code.
content.html: Thinking on downstream maintainers (those working in supporting gazebo for the different platforms and distributions) it would be nice to mention that we are introducing a new optional dependency. Quickly looking at the changelog they will be able to find that their package could need an update on its packaging code.

content.raw:
Minor GUI details:

* I click on the video button, the encoding starts.
* I click on the icon again, and the small window with the stop button shows up. Sometimes, there's an orange frame around the window but I don't see it all the times. Also, if I move the mouse pointer outside of the close window and go back again, the orange frame disappears. 
* The **p** from Sto**p** looks a little cut on my screen, and looks like a **D**.
content.html:
Minor GUI details:

  • I click on the video button, the encoding starts.
  • I click on the icon again, and the small window with the stop button shows up. Sometimes, there's an orange frame around the window but I don't see it all the times. Also, if I move the mouse pointer outside of the close window and go back again, the orange frame disappears.
  • The p from Stop looks a little cut on my screen, and looks like a D.

there's cppcheck complaints about these variables being unused:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/117/cppcheckResult/

maybe it's because they are defined outside the ifdef where they are used? I bet the warnings would go away if we move these lines next to line 368

there's cppcheck complaints about these variables being unused:

content.raw: Thanks. I just removed this two variables, and directly set `this->dataPtr->codecCtx->width` and `this->dataPtr->codecCtx->height`.
